trans-unit.source: Windows Universal Apps SDK Upgrade Procedures
trans-unit.target: Windows Universal Apps SDK Upgrade Procedures

trans-unit.source: Windows Universal Apps SDK Upgrade Procedures for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Windows Universal Apps SDK Upgrade Procedures for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: Windows Universal Apps SDK Upgrade Procedures
trans-unit.target: Windows Universal Apps SDK Upgrade Procedures

trans-unit.source: If you already have integrated an older version of Engagement into your application, you have to consider the following points when upgrading the SDK.
trans-unit.target: If you already have integrated an older version of Engagement into your application, you have to consider the following points when upgrading the SDK.

trans-unit.source: You may have to follow several procedures if you missed several versions of the SDK.
trans-unit.target: You may have to follow several procedures if you missed several versions of the SDK.

trans-unit.source: For example if you migrate from 0.10.1 to 0.11.0 you have to first follow the "from 0.9.0 to 0.10.1" procedure then the "from 0.10.1 to 0.11.0" procedure.
trans-unit.target: For example if you migrate from 0.10.1 to 0.11.0 you have to first follow the "from 0.9.0 to 0.10.1" procedure then the "from 0.10.1 to 0.11.0" procedure.

trans-unit.source: Resources
trans-unit.target: Resources

trans-unit.source: This step concerns customized resources only.
trans-unit.target: This step concerns customized resources only.

trans-unit.source: If you have customized the resources provided by the SDK (html, images, overlay) then you have to backup them before upgrading and reapply your customization on upgraded resources.
trans-unit.target: If you have customized the resources provided by the SDK (html, images, overlay) then you have to backup them before upgrading and reapply your customization on upgraded resources.

trans-unit.source: The following describes how to migrate an SDK integration from the Capptain service offered by Capptain SAS into an app powered by Azure Mobile Engagement.
trans-unit.target: The following describes how to migrate an SDK integration from the Capptain service offered by Capptain SAS into an app powered by Azure Mobile Engagement.

trans-unit.source: [Azure.IMPORTANT] Capptain and Mobile Engagement are not the same services and the procedure given below only highlights how to migrate the client app.
trans-unit.target: [Azure.IMPORTANT] Capptain and Mobile Engagement are not the same services and the procedure given below only highlights how to migrate the client app.

trans-unit.source: Migrating the SDK in the app will NOT migrate your data from the Capptain servers to the Mobile Engagement servers
trans-unit.target: Migrating the SDK in the app will NOT migrate your data from the Capptain servers to the Mobile Engagement servers

trans-unit.source: If you are migrating from an earlier version, please consult the Capptain web site to migrate to 1.1.1 first then apply the following procedure
trans-unit.target: If you are migrating from an earlier version, please consult the Capptain web site to migrate to 1.1.1 first then apply the following procedure

trans-unit.source: Nuget package
trans-unit.target: Nuget package

trans-unit.source: Replace **Capptain.WindowsPhone** by **MicrosoftAzure.MobileEngagement** Nuget package.
trans-unit.target: Replace **Capptain.WindowsPhone** by **MicrosoftAzure.MobileEngagement** Nuget package.

trans-unit.source: Applying Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Applying Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: The SDK uses the term `Engagement`.
trans-unit.target: The SDK uses the term `Engagement`.

trans-unit.source: You need to update your project to match this change.
trans-unit.target: You need to update your project to match this change.

trans-unit.source: You need to uninstall your current Capptain nuget package.
trans-unit.target: You need to uninstall your current Capptain nuget package.

trans-unit.source: Consider that all your changes in Capptain Resources folder will be removed.
trans-unit.target: Consider that all your changes in Capptain Resources folder will be removed.

trans-unit.source: If you want to keep those files then make a copy of them.
trans-unit.target: If you want to keep those files then make a copy of them.

trans-unit.source: After that, install the new Microsoft Azure Engagement nuget package on your project.
trans-unit.target: After that, install the new Microsoft Azure Engagement nuget package on your project.

trans-unit.source: You can find it directly on [nuget website].
trans-unit.target: You can find it directly on [nuget website].

trans-unit.source: or here index.
trans-unit.target: or here index.

trans-unit.source: This action replaces all resources files used by Engagement and adds the new Engagement DLL to your project References.
trans-unit.target: This action replaces all resources files used by Engagement and adds the new Engagement DLL to your project References.

trans-unit.source: You have to clean your project references by deleting Capptain DLL references.
trans-unit.target: You have to clean your project references by deleting Capptain DLL references.

trans-unit.source: If you do not make this, the version of Capptain will conflict and errors will happen.
trans-unit.target: If you do not make this, the version of Capptain will conflict and errors will happen.

trans-unit.source: If you have customized Capptain resources, copy your old files content and paste them in the new Engagement files.
trans-unit.target: If you have customized Capptain resources, copy your old files content and paste them in the new Engagement files.

trans-unit.source: Please note that both xaml and cs files have to be updated.
trans-unit.target: Please note that both xaml and cs files have to be updated.

trans-unit.source: When those steps are completed you only have to replace old Capptain references by the new Engagement references.
trans-unit.target: When those steps are completed you only have to replace old Capptain references by the new Engagement references.

trans-unit.source: All Capptain namespaces have to be updated.
trans-unit.target: All Capptain namespaces have to be updated.

trans-unit.source: Before migration:
trans-unit.target: Before migration:

trans-unit.source: After migration:
trans-unit.target: After migration:

trans-unit.source: All Capptain classes that contain "Capptain" should contain "Engagement".
trans-unit.target: All Capptain classes that contain "Capptain" should contain "Engagement".

trans-unit.source: Before migration:
trans-unit.target: Before migration:

trans-unit.source: After migration:
trans-unit.target: After migration:

trans-unit.source: For xaml files Capptain namespace and attributes also change.
trans-unit.target: For xaml files Capptain namespace and attributes also change.

trans-unit.source: Before migration:
trans-unit.target: Before migration:

trans-unit.source: After migration:
trans-unit.target: After migration:

trans-unit.source: Overlay page changes
trans-unit.target: Overlay page changes

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Overlay also changes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Overlay also changes.

trans-unit.source: Its new namespace is `Microsoft.Azure.Engagement.Overlay`.
trans-unit.target: Its new namespace is `Microsoft.Azure.Engagement.Overlay`.

trans-unit.source: It has to be used in both xaml and cs files.
trans-unit.target: It has to be used in both xaml and cs files.

trans-unit.source: Moreover `CapptainGrid` is to be named `EngagementGrid`, `capptain_notification_content` and `capptain_announcement_content` are named `engagement_notification_content` and `engagement_announcement_content`.
trans-unit.target: Moreover `CapptainGrid` is to be named `EngagementGrid`, `capptain_notification_content` and `capptain_announcement_content` are named `engagement_notification_content` and `engagement_announcement_content`.

trans-unit.source: For overlay :
trans-unit.target: For overlay :

trans-unit.source: It becomes :
trans-unit.target: It becomes :

trans-unit.source: For the other resources like Capptain pictures and HTML files, please note that they also have been renamed to use "Engagement".
trans-unit.target: For the other resources like Capptain pictures and HTML files, please note that they also have been renamed to use "Engagement".

trans-unit.source: Project declaration
trans-unit.target: Project declaration

trans-unit.source: On Package.appxmanifest `File Type Associations` has been updated from :
trans-unit.target: On Package.appxmanifest `File Type Associations` has been updated from :

trans-unit.source: capptain\_reach\_content to engagement\_reach\_content
trans-unit.target: capptain\_reach\_content to engagement\_reach\_content

trans-unit.source: capptain\_log\_file to engagement\_log\_file
trans-unit.target: capptain\_log\_file to engagement\_log\_file

trans-unit.source: Application ID / SDK Key
trans-unit.target: Application ID / SDK Key

trans-unit.source: Engagement uses a connection string.
trans-unit.target: Engagement uses a connection string.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to specify an application ID and an SDK key with Mobile Engagement, you only have to specify a connection string.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to specify an application ID and an SDK key with Mobile Engagement, you only have to specify a connection string.

trans-unit.source: You can set it up on your EngagementConfiguration file.
trans-unit.target: You can set it up on your EngagementConfiguration file.

trans-unit.source: The Engagement configuration can be set in your `Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml` file of your project.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement configuration can be set in your `Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml` file of your project.

trans-unit.source: Edit this file to specify:
trans-unit.target: Edit this file to specify:

trans-unit.source: Your application connection string between tags `<connectionString>` and `<\connectionString>`.
trans-unit.target: Your application connection string between tags `<connectionString>` and `<\connectionString>`.

trans-unit.source: If you want to specify it at runtime instead, you can call the following method before the Engagement agent initialization:
trans-unit.target: If you want to specify it at runtime instead, you can call the following method before the Engagement agent initialization:

trans-unit.source: The connection string for your application is displayed on the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The connection string for your application is displayed on the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Items name change
trans-unit.target: Items name change

trans-unit.source: All items named *capptain* have been named *engagement*.
trans-unit.target: All items named *capptain* have been named *engagement*.

trans-unit.source: Similarly for *Capptain* to *Engagement*.
trans-unit.target: Similarly for *Capptain* to *Engagement*.

trans-unit.source: Examples of commonly used Capptain items :
trans-unit.target: Examples of commonly used Capptain items :

trans-unit.source: CapptainConfiguration now named EngagementConfiguration
trans-unit.target: CapptainConfiguration now named EngagementConfiguration

trans-unit.source: CapptainAgent now named EngagementAgent
trans-unit.target: CapptainAgent now named EngagementAgent

trans-unit.source: CapptainReach now named EngagementReach
trans-unit.target: CapptainReach now named EngagementReach

trans-unit.source: CapptainHttpConfig now named EngagementHttpConfig
trans-unit.target: CapptainHttpConfig now named EngagementHttpConfig

trans-unit.source: GetCapptainPageName now named GetEngagementPageName
trans-unit.target: GetCapptainPageName now named GetEngagementPageName

trans-unit.source: Note that rename also affects overridden methods.
trans-unit.target: Note that rename also affects overridden methods.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
